public abstract class Microservice<Member> extends com.telenav.kivakit.application.Application implements com.telenav.kivakit.core.language.trait.TryTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.lifecycle.Startable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.lifecycle.Stoppable<com.telenav.kivakit.core.time.Duration>

Base class for KivaKit microservices.

Creating a Microservice

A microservice extending this base class needs to:

  1. Create the Microservice subclass in the application's main(String[]) method
  2. Call Application.run(String[]), passing in the arguments to main()
  3. Optionally, pass any Project class to the constructor to ensure dependent projects are initialized
  4. Override onNewRestService() to provide the microservice's RestService subclass
  5. Override metadata() to provide MicroserviceMetadata used in the REST OpenAPI specification at /open-api/swagger.json
  6. Optionally, override onNewWebApplication() to provide an Apache Wicket WicketWebApplication subclass

Example:

 public class MyMicroservice extends Microservice
 {
     public static void main( String[] arguments)
     {
         new MyMicroservice().run(arguments);
     }

     protected MyMicroservice()
     {
         super(new MyMicroserviceProject());
     }

     public MicroserviceMetaData metadata()
     {
         return new MicroserviceMetadata()
             .withName("my-microservice")
             .withDescription("My microservice!")
             .withVersion(Version.of(1, 0));
     }

     @Override
     public MyRestService onNewRestService()
     {
         return new MyRestService(this);
     }

     @Override
     public MyWebApplication onNewWebApplication()
     {
         return new MyWebApplication(this);
     }
 }

Command Line Switches

KivaKit will parse the command line and start the microservice on any port passed to the command line with -port=[port]. If no port is specified, the port in MicroserviceSettings will be used, as loaded from the Deployment specified on the command line with -deployment=[deployment].

Mount Paths

Microservice resources are mounted on the following paths by default:

Mount Paths
/ Apache Wicket web application
/ Microservlet REST application
/assets Static resources
/docs Swagger documentation
/open-api/assets Static resources for use in OpenAPI definitions
/open-api/swagger.json Open API definition
/swagger/webapp Swagger application
/swagger/webjar Swagger design webjar

Root Path

The method rootPath() returns / (slash) by default. This method can be overridden to put all resources under a different root. For example, version 1.0 of the REST API for my-microservice would be mounted under /api/1.0. But if rootPath() returned /[microservice-name], the API root for version 1.0 would be /my-microservice/api/1.0.

Cluster Membership

When a microservice starts up, it automatically joins a cluster of similar microservices. The MicroserviceCluster retrieved with the cluster() method models the cluster and is organized through Apache Zookeeper. When members join and leave the cluster the onJoin(MicroserviceClusterMember) and onLeave(MicroserviceClusterMember) methods will be called. The set of members of the cluster can be retrieved with MicroserviceCluster.members(), and the leader with MicroserviceCluster.leader().

Cluster Elections

Any time a member joins or leaves, an election is held by the MicroserviceCluster. If this microservice is the elected leader of the cluster, the isLeader() method will return true.

    • isClustered

      public boolean isClustered()
      Returns true if this microservice is clustered. To be clustered, two things are required:
      1. onNewMember() must be overridden to return a value
      2. A configuration for ZookeeperConnection must be available (normally in the deployments package) next to the application

    • isLeader

      public boolean isLeader()
      Returns true if this microservice is the leader of the cluster

    • isRunning

      public boolean isRunning()
      This method implements the Operation.isRunning() method. It returns true if the service is running and false otherwise. The start() method should not be called, as this microservice will start running automatically when the Application.run(String[]) method is called from the Java main(String[]) method entrypoint.
      Specified by:
      isRunning in interface com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.lifecycle.Operation
      Returns:
      True if this microservice is running

    • onInitialize

      public void onInitialize()
      Called to initialize the microservice before it's running. This is a good place to register objects with RegistryTrait.register(Object) or RegistryTrait.register(Object, Enum). While settings can be registered in this method, for most microservices, it will make more sense to use the more automatic method provided by Deployments.

      public boolean start()
      Not public API

      Implements the method Startable.start() and starts the microservice running. This method is called by onRun() and should not be called by framework users.
